Why yes... I'm sure just about all of us are playing Doom at this point. Whether you bought it or downloaded it, we are all playin it. Frankly I love it. I honestly wasn't expecting too much from it. I played the old Doom games and thought they were cool enough, but I didn't think they were amazing. The repeating maps and constant mazes of crap left me a bit bored... but I had fun gunning down all the baddies that's for sure. I'm more of a Duke Nukem kinda guy I guess. It just felt like Duke was more fun.. more entertaining. There just seemed to be more imagination and creativity in it. Not to mention it was oh so very tongue-in-cheek. Doom just tried to take itself too seriously. So when I was watching all the press on Doom 3, I was only looking at the visual quality. Being a 3D geek of sorts, I was getting a kick out of all the new lighting and texturing techniques that Carmack and his boys were implementing, but everything just looked TOO dark.. if there is such a thing in a horror game. But once I loaded it up, I was blown away.. the overall look and feel is amazing. Its completely different than what I felt it was going to be from the screenshots... Don't judge a book by its cover I guess. The game is great and I'm loving playing it. Story.. hmm.. did the original Doom have a story? Some Doom lovers say yes, it had a deep story. Well from my recollection the story was about the same as Half Life... scientists open a portal to somewhere and bad shit comes through.. its your job to stem the tide of baddies and win the day. Not a big deal really because even Carmack is quoted as saying that in the Doom games, story comes last. That's just the type of game they are, so I'm not complaining about Doom 3 lacking much of a story. I do love the extra work that id went through to make this game stand out. I love the PDA, and love all the stuff that comes along with it. The emails are damn cool, and the website tie-ins make it all the better! Then there is the computer screens in game. This was one of the first things that made me go YESSSS when I started playing it. The fact that they aren't 2 state maps that are either o or off.... they are animated and have several usable buttons on them... That's just a great touch. Kudos id.. Subtleties make all the difference. I fell I'm not THAT far from the last parts of the game and its a bit sad really. I was hoping that the game would be a bit longer... ahh well. I've put in probably about 10-15 hours so far.. not more than that for sure. Things do pick up once you are in Delta Labs, and I cant wait to see what I run into next! Ill have some various screenshots up later this weekend. I've been taking them as I go along when cool stuff happens and ill throw some NON-spoilers up later today possibly. Hopefully ill get to try the co-op mod later tonight as well with a few guys.. man that would ROCK! Until then... -Ruiner
